page.title: 01PARISH OF LLANFAIRWATERDINE
page.content: This small section of Shropshire and fragment of Powys is true border country. Totally unspoilt it rises up from the valley of the river Teme which forms the boundary between England and Wales. Very hilly indeed it is wonderful walking country, the bare hills are softly rounded grassy with quite deeply indented narrow valleys, mostly wooded running downwards to the river, made even more attractive with the chatter of a gurgling stream. They are not high,never rising to more than 1,104 feet but the slopes are often steep and their tops seem wild and barren though fused extensively for rough grazing and the occasional field of arable crops. The views are wonderful from every aspect, looking northwards across the valleys and hills to the height s of Shropshire.
